review_title: Culture heading in the wrong direction.
pros:
I am having a hard time thinking of anything positive right now. Some of the cafeteria specials aren't too bad? 
All kidding aside, Anthem has the potential to be a great place to work, but the current culture brought on by the new CEO is puzzling at best. They seem to be going backwards into an antiquated and very strict corporate environment. It's just not a great place to be right now.
cons:
Locked in the position you are hired as, no career path for advancement. Anthem does very little to develop their talent, they would rather hire from the outside than promote from within. 
Opaque leadership, they often do not disseminate information to lower levels of staff, especially regarding layoffs. It's not uncommon for people and departments to "disappear" with no plan of replacement. 
Work from home polices are slowly being taking away. 
Tedious time time tracking and micromanagement stands in the way of any real productivity. The appearance of being busy, and documenting your time is far more important than the actual merit of your work. 
CEO has created a negative culture, every new rule and initiative feels like a punishment. 
Bonuses are being reduced for "reasons". 
Contracted and temp workers have replaced full time staff.
Advice to Management
Stop and take a look at your employees, we're all miserable with these new policies. You are losing a lot of institutional knowledge. 
Maybe take a chance on some of the talent you already have, I mean you hired us, we can't be that bad. Promote from within to avoid stagnation.
Helpful (22

review_title: Generally, a very supportive and engaging environment of teams solving for better healthcare.

Good benefits and pay
Diversity conscious and diversity driven
Virtual options
cons:

Some limited areas with inadequately matched leadership

Look for hidden gems of talent that may be buried in the wrong role or under the wrong structure.

Helpfu

pros: Health, Dental, Vision, & Life Benefits
cons:
No organization..started 9/4 & finished training at the end of October...got out of training and had no desk, computer, or phone to do my job efficiently and to the best of my ability. Points/Occurrences don’t fall off until 1 year. They expect you to have no more than 2 absences during 1st 90 days which is not bad bc I’m usually prompt and never miss days from work unless NECESSARY. My car broke down and they did not care. I didn’t stay locally so I couldn’t carpool with anyone & had to miss 2 days until my car was repaired. After that, my son had been withdrawn from school for “residency issues” so I had to miss a day to take care of that & I was fired due to attendance. These things happened unexpectedly and were out of my control and THEY HAD NO REMORSE! They pick and choose who to give overtime to. Worked there 3 months and didn’t get a desk with ONE monitor (job requires 2..even states it in the CSR job description) until the end of those 3 months which should have been supplied to us immediately after training. VERY LOW PAY, they don’t pay based on experience so you can forget that! No opportunity to advance until after you’ve been in your role for a year & supervisors don’t approve you to be released into another position because I guess they don’t believe in growth & advancement. Don’t even waste your time. This job is fitting for someone fresh out of high school to make a little extra cash or older ppl who can’t seem to find work bc of their age. Bonuses??? A JOKE! They advertise that as if it’s really great...they even told us on our first day that it’s not much(less than $200) and that’s even if you’ve been rocking all your calls and receiving great surveys bc it’s based on the entire department, not just YOU individually. I WOULDN’T RECOMMEND THIS JOB TO ANYONE!!! This is not out of anger because I was aware of the attendance policy and knew the repercussions behind it. I didn’t leave on bad terms. I just know that there’s a lot of things within this company that are unfair and I want to warn others before going through what I did.
Advice to Management
Be more considerate of unexpected absences especially if the associate is doing great with adherence and receiving great survey/audit scores, as well as assisting her peers with a great attitude.
Helpful (7
advice_to_mgmt: Be more considerate of unexpected absences especially if the associate is doing great with adherence and receiving great survey/audit scores, as well as assisting her peers with a great attitude.
